title: A Cluster-Based Filtering Technique for Denoising 4D-STEM Datasets
content: The introduction of direct electron detectors has facilitated the rapid acquisition of 4D-STEM datasets (Figure 1(a)), benefiting nanobeam 4D-STEM applications such as strain mapping. Nonetheless, the sensitivity to Poisson noise poses a notable obstacle, particularly regarding the precision required for strain measurements. In nanobeam 4D-STEM, the accuracy of strain measurements is intrinsically linked to the precise determination of Bragg peak centers of mass [1]. Various denoising techniques exist. However, they often come with compromises, such as reduction of resolution or artifact introduction.
